hero.heading: Native WhatsApp for Linux
hero.subtitle: A {{native}} WhatsApp experience for Linux with multi-account support, system notifications, and much more.

featureSection.heading: Features that make a <1>difference</1>
featureSection.subtitle: ZapZap offers a complete native WhatsApp experience, specifically designed for Linux users.

features.title: Multiple Accounts
features.description: Manage multiple WhatsApp accounts simultaneously in a single interface.

features.title: Native Notifications
features.description: Receive system notifications integrated with the Linux environment.

features.title: Media Sharing
features.description: Drag and drop files directly to send photos, videos, and documents.

features.title: Custom Themes
features.description: Automatically adapts to your system's light and dark themes.

features.title: Privacy Respected
features.description: No data collection. Your privacy is our priority.

features.title: Background Mode
features.description: Keep receiving messages even when the window is minimized.

whyChoose.title: Simple
whyChoose.description: Clean and intuitive interface. No complications, just the WhatsApp experience you already know.

whyChoose.title: Native
whyChoose.description: Full integration with Linux. Keyboard shortcuts, notifications, and native system behavior.

whyChoose.title: Free
whyChoose.description: Open source and free. No limitations, no hidden costs. Contribute and help improve the project.

downloadSection.heading: Choose your <1>distribution</1>
downloadSection.subtitle: ZapZap is available in multiple formats to support all Linux distributions.

options.title: Flatpak
options.description: Secure installation with sandboxing via Flathub. Compatible with a wide range of Linux distributions.

options.title: AppImage
options.description: Download, make executable and run — no installation needed. A portable and hassle-free option.

options.title: Fedora
options.description: Available via Copr. Install and keep ZapZap updated on Fedora using DNF.

options.title: AUR
options.description: Install ZapZap on Arch-based systems via Arch User Repository (AUR). Package maintained by the community.

aboutSection.subtitle: Learn more about the developer and the Linux community collaboration for ZapZap development.
paragraphs: ZapZap is a native-like WhatsApp client for Linux, offering advanced features such as multi-account support, system tray notifications, drag-and-drop media, spell checking, and dynamic theming.
Built with ❤️ by Rafael Tosta, a developer focused on creating accessible and efficient desktop applications using modern web and desktop technologies.
The project is open-source and community-driven. You can find it on GitHub and contribute to its development or improvements.

footer.description: The best native-like WhatsApp client for Linux. Open-source, privacy-respecting, and completely free.
footer.copyright: ZapZap. Made for the Linux community.
